Why_It_Happens: When copying formulas, references shift automatically (thats usually helpful, but not always!)
How_To_Fix_It: Use $ signs to lock: $A$1 locks both, $A1 locks column, A$1 locks row. Press F4 to toggle!
Prevention_Tip: Before copying any formula, ask yourself: Should this reference move or stay fixed?

Why_It_Happens: Your formula refers to itself, directly or indirectly. Like cell A1 containing =A1+1
How_To_Fix_It: Find the loop: Formulas > Error Checking > Circular References shows the culprit. Fix the logic!
Prevention_Tip: Plan your formulas first. Draw arrows if needed. A cell should never depend on its own value!

Why_It_Happens: Data imported from other systems often comes as text that looks like numbers
How_To_Fix_It: Select the cells, click the warning icon > Convert to Number. Or use =VALUE() function or Paste Special > Multiply by 1
Prevention_Tip: Check the alignment - real numbers align RIGHT by default. Green triangles warn you too!

Why_It_Happens: Different regions use different formats (MM/DD vs DD/MM). Excel might misinterpret your dates!
How_To_Fix_It: Use unambiguous formats like 15-Jan-2024. Or set your regional settings correctly in Windows.
Prevention_Tip: When sharing files internationally, use TEXT() to display dates or ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD).

Why_It_Happens: You add new data below a range, but your SUM or chart doesnt include it
How_To_Fix_It: Update your formulas, or better yet - use Tables (Ctrl+T) which auto-expand!
Prevention_Tip: Always use Tables for data that will grow. Or use dynamic ranges with OFFSET or structured references.

Why_It_Happens: Pressing Delete removes content but using right-click Delete removes entire rows/columns, shifting everything
How_To_Fix_It: Ctrl+Z immediately! Then use Delete key for content only, or Home > Clear for more options.
Prevention_Tip: Know the difference: Delete key = clear contents. Right-click Delete = remove cells/rows/columns.

Why_It_Happens: It looks nice for headers but completely breaks sorting, filtering, and formulas
How_To_Fix_It: Unmerge (Home > Merge & Center again), then use Center Across Selection instead (Format Cells > Alignment)
Prevention_Tip: Avoid merging in data areas. Use Center Across Selection for the same visual effect without the problems!

Why_It_Happens: Raw data ranges dont auto-expand, dont have easy filtering, and formulas are harder to read
How_To_Fix_It: Select your data and press Ctrl+T to convert to a Table. Name it something meaningful!
Prevention_Tip: Always convert structured data to Tables immediately. Theres almost no downside and tons of benefits!

Why_It_Happens: Typing calculated values directly instead of using formulas, so nothing updates automatically
How_To_Fix_It: Replace static values with formulas. If you typed 150, change it to =A1*B1 or whatever creates that result.
Prevention_Tip: If youre reaching for a calculator, stop! Excel should do that math. Always use formulas.

Why_It_Happens: Seeing #REF!, #VALUE!, #N/A and just leaving them there or hiding them cosmetically
How_To_Fix_It: Understand each error: #REF=deleted reference, #VALUE=wrong data type, #N/A=not found. Fix the root cause!
Prevention_Tip: Learn what each error means. Use IFERROR() only after understanding WHY the error occurs.

The_Mistake: Not Backing Up Before Major Changes
Why_It_Happens: Making huge edits to the only copy of an important file... then realizing you broke everything
How_To_Fix_It: If recent, try Ctrl+Z repeatedly. Otherwise, check for AutoRecover files or previous versions (right-click file > Properties > Previous Versions).
Prevention_Tip: Save a copy BEFORE major changes. Use version numbers like Budget_v1, Budget_v2. Or use OneDrive/SharePoint versioning!

Why_It_Happens: Writing =A1*0.15 instead of referencing a cell containing 0.15
How_To_Fix_It: Create an Assumptions or Parameters area with labeled values. Reference those cells in formulas.
Prevention_Tip: Put all changeable values in dedicated cells with labels. Makes updating and auditing SO much easier!

Why_It_Happens: Same thing entered different ways: NYC, New York, new york, N.Y.C.
How_To_Fix_It: Use Data Validation dropdowns, or Find & Replace to standardize. TRIM() and PROPER() help clean up.
Prevention_Tip: Create dropdown lists for any field with limited valid options. Prevents typos and variations!

Why_It_Happens: Applying filters, then forgetting theyre on. Your totals look wrong, you miss data, panic ensues!
How_To_Fix_It: Look for the filter icons in headers and the row numbers (theyll skip numbers if filtered). Click Clear in Data tab.
Prevention_Tip: Always check the status bar - it shows X of Y records found. Blue row numbers = filtered data!

Why_It_Happens: Hitting print and getting 47 pages with one column per page, or cutting off important data
How_To_Fix_It: Always use Print Preview (Ctrl+P). Adjust Page Layout settings: orientation, margins, scaling, print area.
Prevention_Tip: Set up Page Layout FIRST for any file youll print. Use Print Titles for headers on every page!

Why_It_Happens: Forgetting the 4th argument (FALSE) in VLOOKUP and getting wrong results from approximate matching
How_To_Fix_It: Always include FALSE as the 4th argument: =VLOOKUP(value, range, col, FALSE). Or switch to XLOOKUP if you have Excel 365!
Prevention_Tip: Consider using XLOOKUP instead - it defaults to exact match and is better in every way! Note: XLOOKUP requires Excel 365 or Excel 2021.

Why_It_Happens: Pasting data and suddenly your carefully formatted sheet looks like a ransom note
How_To_Fix_It: Use Paste Special (Ctrl+Alt+V) > Values to paste just the data. Or use the paste options button that appears.
Prevention_Tip: Get in the habit of using Paste Special for data from external sources. In Excel, use Ctrl+Alt+V to open Paste Special dialog.

Why_It_Happens: Using the wrong keyboard shortcut for Paste Special and wondering why it doesnt work
How_To_Fix_It: In Excel, the correct shortcut is Ctrl+Alt+V (not Ctrl+Shift+V!). Ctrl+Shift+V is for Google Sheets - they use different shortcuts!
Prevention_Tip: Remember: Excel = Ctrl+Alt+V for Paste Special. Google Sheets = Ctrl+Shift+V. Dont mix them up!

Why_It_Happens: Formulas dont match because of invisible leading/trailing spaces or weird characters
How_To_Fix_It: Use =TRIM() to remove extra spaces, =CLEAN() for non-printable characters. Check with =LEN() to compare.
Prevention_Tip: Always TRIM imported data. If A1 looks like Apple but LEN(A1)=7, you have hidden characters!

Why_It_Happens: Leaving default names like Sheet1, Sheet2, Sheet3... then forgetting whats where
How_To_Fix_It: Double-click the sheet tab to rename. Use clear, short names: Data, Summary, Charts, Lookup_Tables.
Prevention_Tip: Rename sheets immediately when you create them. Your future self will thank you!

Why_It_Happens: Assuming imported or inherited data is clean and accurate... spoiler: it usually isnt!
How_To_Fix_It: Use conditional formatting to highlight outliers. Check with COUNTBLANK, COUNTIF. Spot-check random samples.
Prevention_Tip: Always do a data health check: look for blanks, duplicates (use Remove Duplicates), and outliers before analysis!
